blog.name: glitteryfics
blog.title: Fics with a touch of glitter
blog.description:
Fanfics by glitterfics from a range of fandoms. 
Mostly slash so it that offends you then you're in the wrong place.

summary: Can We Bring Yesterday Back Around?
title: Can We Bring Yesterday Back Around?
body:
Title: Can We Bring Yesterday Back Around?
Author name: glitterfics
Beta name: lazydazyfics
Characters/Pairing: Clint Barton/Steve Rogers
Fandom/Universe: Marvel Cinematic Universe
Rating: NC-17
Word count: 40,000
Content Notes/Warnings: Betaed by my beloved Lazydazyjax. The brilliant header was made by sandrasfisher and check out the breathtaking drawing in the fic that was done by the lovely Reminicious <3 <3 <3
This story starts just after ‘Thor’ but is mainly set in between 'The Avengers’ and 'Captain America Winter Soldier’. I’ve moved all the locations in CAWS to New York so that it ties in with the end of The Avengers; that includes the Barton’s farm being in some kind of rural area outside NYC. Written for marvel-bang 2018.

Summary: When he got back from New Mexico, Clint was given the incredibly boring task of watching the newly defrosted Captain America adjust to modern life. He didn’t expect it to lead to a misunderstanding, an impromptu make-out session and a blown mission. But that’s alright because he was unlikely to run into Steve Rogers again. Right?

blog.name: benedict-wong
blog.title: higher, further, faster
blog.description: lila, 19, bi. multifandom mess [semi-hiatus; most posts are queued]

title: GHOST AND THE SPIDER ©
body:
CHAPTER 1

AUTHORS NOTE: This is my first fanfic so hopefully it not too terrible.

SUMMARY: Y/N Stark was the only daughter of the genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist Tony Stark. She went missing 4 years ago and was presumed dead by most of the world. Tony and The Avengers never gave up hope that Y/N was alive, however a lot can happen in 4 years and people can change. Will they find Y/N and if so will she be the same girl they remember or just a ghost of her former self?

PAIRINGS: Peter Parker x Y/N Stark, Y/N x Tony (father!daughter), Y/N x Avengers.

WARNINGS: Violence (like quite a lot), language, angst, torture, gore?

GIFS ARE NOT MINE.

Pain was all I felt as I gained consciousness it tore through every cell in my body making me groan in pain. I tried to sit up but soon realised my wrists and ankles were bound to a metal table. Oh great, I must have passed out from the pain.

I looked around the room as best I could given my current position, it was then that I noticed that there were no guards or doctors in the room with me. Strange, there’s normally at least one guard here when I wake up. I tried to yank my arm free from its restraints even though I knew it was pointless but hey, you can’t blame a girl for trying right.

I heard the muffled voices through the metal door, seconds later it opened to reveal a Hydra agent. He entered the room and locked the door behind him, he smirked at me and I rolled my eyes in response. What a dick.

“What have you been told about rolling your fucking eyes?!” he growled at me as he stalked closer.

“I’m not too sure, you see torture kind of fucks up my memory.” I said casually as I smirked at his enraged face. God it was just too fucking easy to piss him off. He stepped up next to my head and grabbed my chin harshly in his rough hand.

“Who the fuck do you think you’re talking you little bitch?!” he hissed in my ear before sending a hard punch straight to my nose, I heard the crack and knew instantly that he had broken it. Fucking perfect, it’s only just healed from the last break. A satisfied smirk played on his lips as he watched the blood come gushing out of my nose and down my face. “It’s about time you learn your place little girl.” As he leaned in to continue his boring ass rant about me being insubordinate I spat the blood that had been collecting in my mouth directly into his face. He stood there dumbfounded with his mouth open. It was so worth it.

He yelled out in rage and I knew what was coming next, he sent a flurry of fists flying directly at my face, each hit seemed harder than the last. The door opened again and in walked three more guards all with amused smirks gracing there lips. They unstrapped me from the table, it’s honestly like the were asking for me to kick there asses, as soon as both my wrists and ankles were unbound I leapt off the table and onto my feet ready in a fighting stance, knocking one of the guards over in the process.

Blood was falling from my face in a steady stream now but I didn’t care, I was used to the pain. The guard on the floor swiftly stood up and sent a glare my way, I smirked challenging him to make a move, he lunged at me with his knife, I easily avoided his attack and grabbed his arm maneuvering it so that I could grab his knife, he lunged again and quickly regretted it as the knife pierced his chest, he fell to the floor with a deafening thud. The three remaining agents looked at each other as if silently coming up with a plan to take me down.

They nodded at each other and tried to ambush me, I quickly ducked and rolled over to the dead body on the floor, pulling the knife out of his chest, I swiftly threw it at another agent where it lodged itself in his throat, he grasped at his neck trying to stop the blood that poured out of him like a fountain. Before I had a chance to execute my next attack the door clanged open and a swarm of agents swarmed into the room with riot shields, they raised their guns and aimed them directly as me, as I turned to attack once more I felt a searing pain in my right shoulder, I looked down to see the bullet wound oozing black blood. Why did they always have to lace the bullets with poison?!

My eyes struggled open as the effects of the poison wore off, it felt like my head was literally splitting in half. I realised I was back in my cell, I struggled to sit up on the bed (if you can call it that). I looked down to see my clothes soaked in my blood, apparently me being unconscious gave them the perfect chance to beat the shit out of me. My skin was littered in bruises and cuts varying in size, it also felt like I had a broken ankle and dislocated shoulder. I sighed to myself as I lay down on the bed slowly drifting back into the comfort of unconsciousness.

••

I was pulled back to the world at the sound of my cell door being unlocked, a single agent entered the room with his gun drawn looking anxious, “ Get up, we’re leaving.” I nodded and slowly lifted myself of the bed and began walking over to the agent. “No funny business.” he stated as he aimed his gun at my head and gestured for me to exit first.

Walking through the halls of the building I knew something was wrong, agents ran back and forth preparing to abandon anything that wasn’t of value to them. I scanned the area trying to figure out what had everyone so worked up, I felt the agent that was escorting me press his gun against the back of my head, I rolled my eyes. Enough of this shit.

I spun around quickly grabbing the agents gun, he fired a shot that skimmed my neck, I twisted his arm until I heard the crack and he released the gun, before he even had time to react he was on the ground with a bullet between his eyes. Time to get out of this shit hole.

I took off running as best I could with the crippling pain coming from my ankle. Definitely broken. I took out every Hydra agent I came into contact with, by the time I made it to the exit I was caked in both my blood and the blood of the agents I’d killed. Taking in a deep breath I opened the door to freedom, the wind whipped my hair around as I relished in the feeling of finally being in the outdoors. I heard the door I had just escaped from opening, I aimed my gun at whoever was brave enough to exit. I won’t go back. As the door opened I prepared to take the shot when the familiar glint of a red and blue shield caught my eye making me remove my finger from the trigger, while still keeping the gun trained on the door.

“Drop the gun kid.”

My skin was littered in bruises and cuts varying in size, it also felt like I had a broken ankle and dislocated shoulder. I looked around the room as best I could given my current position, it was then that I noticed that there were no guards or doctors in the room with me. Strange, there’s normally at least one guard here when I wake up. I tried to yank my arm free from its restraints even though I knew it was pointless but hey, you can’t blame a girl for trying right.

I heard the muffled voices through the metal door, seconds later it opened to reveal a Hydra agent. He entered the room and locked the door behind him, he smirked at me and I rolled my eyes in response. What a dick.

“What have you been told about rolling your fucking eyes?!” he growled at me as he stalked closer.

“I’m not too sure, you see torture kind of fucks up my memory.” I said casually as I smirked at his enraged face. God it was just too fucking easy to piss him off. He stepped up next to my head and grabbed my chin harshly in his rough hand.

“Who the fuck do you think you’re talking you little bitch?!” he hissed in my ear before sending a hard punch straight to my nose, I heard the crack and knew instantly that he had broken it. Fucking perfect, it’s only just healed from the last break. A satisfied smirk played on his lips as he watched the blood come gushing out of my nose and down my face. “It’s about time you learn your place little girl.” As he leaned in to continue his boring ass rant about me being insubordinate I spat the blood that had been collecting in my mouth directly into his face. He stood there dumbfounded with his mouth open. It was so worth it.

He yelled out in rage and I knew what was coming next, he sent a flurry of fists flying directly at my face, each hit seemed harder than the last. The door opened again and in walked three more guards all with amused smirks gracing there lips. They unstrapped me from the table, it’s honestly like the were asking for me to kick there asses, as soon as both my wrists and ankles were unbound I leapt off the table and onto my feet ready in a fighting stance, knocking one of the guards over in the process.

Blood was falling from my face in a steady stream now but I didn’t care, I was used to the pain. The guard on the floor swiftly stood up and sent a glare my way, I smirked challenging him to make a move, he lunged at me with his knife, I easily avoided his attack and grabbed his arm maneuvering it so that I could grab his knife, he lunged again and quickly regretted it as the knife pierced his chest, he fell to the floor with a deafening thud. The three remaining agents looked at each other as if silently coming up with a plan to take me down.

They nodded at each other and tried to ambush me, I quickly ducked and rolled over to the dead body on the floor, pulling the knife out of his chest, I swiftly threw it at another agent where it lodged itself in his throat, he grasped at his neck trying to stop the blood that poured out of him like a fountain. Before I had a chance to execute my next attack the door clanged open and a swarm of agents swarmed into the room with riot shields, they raised their guns and aimed them directly as me, as I turned to attack once more I felt a searing pain in my right shoulder, I looked down to see the bullet wound oozing black blood. Why did they always have to lace the bullets with poison?!

My eyes struggled open as the effects of the poison wore off, it felt like my head was literally splitting in half. I realised I was back in my cell, I struggled to sit up on the bed (if you can call it that). I looked down to see my clothes soaked in my blood, apparently me being unconscious gave them the perfect chance to beat the shit out of me. My skin was littered in bruises and cuts varying in size, it also felt like I had a broken ankle and dislocated shoulder. I sighed to myself as I lay down on the bed slowly drifting back into the comfort of unconsciousness.

••

I was pulled back to the world at the sound of my cell door being unlocked, a single agent entered the room with his gun drawn looking anxious, “ Get up, we’re leaving.” I nodded and slowly lifted myself of the bed and began walking over to the agent. “No funny business.” he stated as he aimed his gun at my head and gestured for me to exit first.

Walking through the halls of the building I knew something was wrong, agents ran back and forth preparing to abandon anything that wasn’t of value to them. I scanned the area trying to figure out what had everyone so worked up, I felt the agent that was escorting me press his gun against the back of my head, I rolled my eyes. Enough of this shit.

I spun around quickly grabbing the agents gun, he fired a shot that skimmed my neck, I twisted his arm until I heard the crack and he released the gun, before he even had time to react he was on the ground with a bullet between his eyes. Time to get out of this shit hole.

I took off running as best I could with the crippling pain coming from my ankle. Definitely broken. I took out every Hydra agent I came into contact with, by the time I made it to the exit I was caked in both my blood and the blood of the agents I’d killed. Taking in a deep breath I opened the door to freedom, the wind whipped my hair around as I relished in the feeling of finally being in the outdoors. I heard the door I had just escaped from opening, I aimed my gun at whoever was brave enough to exit. I won’t go back. As the door opened I prepared to take the shot when the familiar glint of a red and blue shield caught my eye making me remove my finger from the trigger, while still keeping the gun trained on the door.

“Drop the gun kid.”
trail.content_abstract:
CHAPTER 1

AUTHORS NOTE: This is my first fanfic so hopefully it not too terrible.

SUMMARY: Y/N Stark was the only daughter of the genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist Tony Stark. She went missing 4 years ago and was presumed dead by most of the world. Tony and The Avengers never gave up hope that Y/N was alive, however a lot can happen in 4 years and people can change. Will they find Y/N and if so will she be the same girl they remember or just a ghost of her former self?

PAIRINGS: Peter Parker x Y/N Stark, Y/N x Tony (father!daughter), Y/N x Avengers.

WARNINGS: Violence (like quite a lot), language, angst, torture, gore?

GIFS ARE NOT MINE.

Pain was all I felt as I gained consciousness it tore through every cell in my body making me groan in pain. I tried to sit up but soon realised my wrists and ankles were bound to a metal table. Oh great, I must have passed out from the pain.

I looked around the room as best I could given my current position, it was then that I noticed that there were no guards or doctors in the room with me. Strange, there’s normally at least one guard here when I wake up. I tried to yank my arm free from its restraints even though I knew it was pointless but hey, you can’t blame a girl for trying right.

I heard the muffled voices through the metal door, seconds later it opened to reveal a Hydra agent. He entered the room and locked the door behind him, he smirked at me and I rolled my eyes in response. What a dick.

“What have you been told about rolling your fucking eyes?!” he growled at me as he stalked closer.

“I’m not too sure, you see torture kind of fucks up my memory.” I said casually as I smirked at his enraged face. God it was just too fucking easy to piss him off. He stepped up next to my head and grabbed my chin harshly in his rough hand.

“Who the fuck do you think you’re talking you little bitch?!” he hissed in my ear before sending a hard punch straight to my nose, I heard the crack and knew instantly that he had broken it. Fucking perfect, it’s only just healed from the last break. A satisfied smirk played on his lips as he watched the blood come gushing out of my nose and down my face. “It’s about time you learn your place little girl.” As he leaned in to continue his boring ass rant about me being insubordinate I spat the blood that had been collecting in my mouth directly into his face. He stood there dumbfounded with his mouth open. It was so worth it.

He yelled out in rage and I knew what was coming next, he sent a flurry of fists flying directly at my face, each hit seemed harder than the last. The door opened again and in walked three more guards all with amused smirks gracing there lips. They unstrapped me from the table, it’s honestly like the were asking for me to kick there asses, as soon as both my wrists and ankles were unbound I leapt off the table and onto my feet ready in a fighting stance, knocking one of the guards over in the process.

Blood was falling from my face in a steady stream now but I didn’t care, I was used to the pain. The guard on the floor swiftly stood up and sent a glare my way, I smirked challenging him to make a move, he lunged at me with his knife, I easily avoided his attack and grabbed his arm maneuvering it so that I could grab his knife, he lunged again and quickly regretted it as the knife pierced his chest, he fell to the floor with a deafening thud. The three remaining agents looked at each other as if silently coming up with a plan to take me down.

They nodded at each other and tried to ambush me, I quickly ducked and rolled over to the dead body on the floor, pulling the knife out of his chest, I swiftly threw it at another agent where it lodged itself in his throat, he grasped at his neck trying to stop the blood that poured out of him like a fountain. Before I had a chance to execute my next attack the door clanged open and a swarm of agents swarmed into the room with riot shields, they raised their guns and aimed them directly as me, as I turned to attack once more I felt a searing pain in my right shoulder, I looked down to see the bullet wound oozing black blood. Why did they always have to lace the bullets with poison?!

My eyes struggled open as the effects of the poison wore off, it felt like my head was literally splitting in half. I realised I was back in my cell, I struggled to sit up on the bed (if you can call it that). I looked down to see my clothes soaked in my blood, apparently me being unconscious gave them the perfect chance to beat the shit out of me. My skin was littered in bruises and cuts varying in size, it also felt like I had a broken ankle and dislocated shoulder. I sighed to myself as I lay down on the bed slowly drifting back into the comfort of unconsciousness.

summary:
We all live to love                            we all fall apart

                                     ...

We all live to love

                           we all fall apart

                                                  We’d all go to war

for the faint of heart


                              Instead we’re condescending

There are no happy endings.

blog.name: suitofhumour
blog.title: Everybody wants a happy ending, right?
blog.description: Hi, I'm Pearl. 26. Xtaticpearl on Ao3. Have fun while you're here.  This is a mix of a multitude of my interests so they'll keep changing.

summary: Steve cried in swallows. Heart crashing into lungs, suffocating in nerves, tears freezing on cheeks. Sorrow flowed in sweat of...
body:
Steve cried in swallows. Heart crashing into lungs, suffocating in nerves, tears freezing on cheeks. Sorrow flowed in sweat of punches thrown, blood spit out from hits taken. He cried in fading transitions - one with the downpour and the landslides he would be buried under.

Tony cried in bites. Half formed lumps, shattering in synapses, teeth grit against escaped sounds. Grief exploded in clanging against burnt metal, dents in scratched exoskeletons. He cried in flashing flares - one with the false stars of festivities and finicky fame in which he would burn.

Thor cried in exhales. Cooling ash against scraped feet, cracking in joints, breathing in old wounds. Torment seeped into his bones in bloodbaths, melting ice with skin attached. He cried in beaten chests - one with the crown around his neck and choking smile with which he would be sculpted.

Natasha cried in blinks. Stained photographs crushed in fists, paralysing in mid motion, moisture dried in swollen eyes. Mortification tied into a bun between changing locks, paint reapplied on old skin colourless. She cried in darkened veils - one with the coffin lined with velvet and roses clinging to broken fences where she would be lost.

Bruce cried in rips. Threadbare memories melded into load, forsaken grasps clenched into self, salt mixed into terrified glares. Despair clipped into burnt fingernails, acid running into all bases. He cried in smudged glasses - one with the fog of polluted freedom and misspelt addresses of homes where he would never stay.

Clint cried in jerks. Motionless hitches of breaths, boiling in vaulted brain, trails down his jaw. Agony shot out of every quiver, screaming in the path of an arrow’s release. He cried in abandoned free falls - one with the wish of unseen endings and breaking homes to find ground over which he would seek remains of himself.

It binds them. It breaks them. It is the human in them. It hurts.

Steve cried in swallows. Heart crashing into lungs, suffocating in nerves, tears freezing on cheeks. Sorrow flowed in sweat of punches thrown, blood spit out from hits taken. He cried in fading transitions - one with the downpour and the landslides he would be buried under.

Tony cried in bites. Half formed lumps, shattering in synapses, teeth grit against escaped sounds. Grief exploded in clanging against burnt metal, dents in scratched exoskeletons. He cried in flashing flares - one with the false stars of festivities and finicky fame in which he would burn.

Thor cried in exhales. Cooling ash against scraped feet, cracking in joints, breathing in old wounds. Torment seeped into his bones in bloodbaths, melting ice with skin attached. He cried in beaten chests - one with the crown around his neck and choking smile with which he would be sculpted.

Natasha cried in blinks. Stained photographs crushed in fists, paralysing in mid motion, moisture dried in swollen eyes. Mortification tied into a bun between changing locks, paint reapplied on old skin colourless. She cried in darkened veils - one with the coffin lined with velvet and roses clinging to broken fences where she would be lost.

Bruce cried in rips. Threadbare memories melded into load, forsaken grasps clenched into self, salt mixed into terrified glares. Despair clipped into burnt fingernails, acid running into all bases. He cried in smudged glasses - one with the fog of polluted freedom and misspelt addresses of homes where he would never stay.

Clint cried in jerks. Motionless hitches of breaths, boiling in vaulted brain, trails down his jaw. Agony shot out of every quiver, screaming in the path of an arrow’s release. He cried in abandoned free falls - one with the wish of unseen endings and breaking homes to find ground over which he would seek remains of himself.

It binds them. It breaks them. It is the human in them. It hurts.
